#labels examples
#Charting examples

== Simple chart==
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=t%3A5%2C4%2C6&cht=p3&chs=300x150&chtt=Servings&chf=bg%2Cs%2CFFFFFF.png

{{{
  $chart = array(
      '#chart_id' => 'test_chart',
      '#title' => t('Servings'),
      '#type' => CHART_TYPE_PIE_3D,
      '#encoding' => CHART_ENCODING_TEXT,
    );
    
  $chart['#data']['fruits'] = 3;
  $chart['#data']['meats']  = 2;
  $chart['#data']['dairy']  = 5;

  echo chart_render($chart);
}}}



== Labels, title styling, and chart size ==
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=t%3A3%2C2%2C5&cht=p&chs=400x200&chtt=Servings&chts=cc0000%2C15&chl=Fruits%7CMeats%7CDairy&chf=bg%2Cs%2CFFFFFF.png

{{{
  $chart = array(
      '#chart_id' => 'test_chart',
      '#title' => chart_title(t('Servings'), 'cc0000', 15),
      '#type' => CHART_TYPE_PIE,
      '#size' => chart_size(400, 200),
      '#encoding' => CHART_ENCODING_TEXT,
    );
    
  $chart['#data']['fruits'] = 3;
  $chart['#data']['meats']  = 2;
  $chart['#data']['dairy']  = 5;

  $chart['#labels'][] = t('Fruits');
  $chart['#labels'][] = t('Meats');
  $chart['#labels'][] = t('Dairy');

  echo chart_render($chart);
}}}



== Custom data colors ==
Alternatively use the the [http://code.google.com/p/drupal-chart-api/wiki/Hooks Color Schemes Hook] which can be then associated to multiple charts containing some or all of the same content.

http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=t%3A3%2C2%2C5&cht=p&chs=400x200&chtt=Servings&chts=cc0000%2C15&chl=Fruits%7CMeats%7CDairy&chco=00ff00%2Cff0000%2C0000ff&chf=bg%2Cs%2CFFFFFF.png

{{{
  $chart = array(
      '#chart_id' => 'test_chart',
      '#title' => chart_title(t('Servings'), 'cc0000', 15),
      '#type' => CHART_TYPE_PIE,
      '#size' => chart_size(400, 200),
      '#encoding' => CHART_ENCODING_TEXT,
    );
    
  $chart['#data']['fruits'] = 3;
  $chart['#data']['meats']  = 2;
  $chart['#data']['dairy']  = 5;

  $chart['#labels'][] = t('Fruits');
  $chart['#labels'][] = t('Meats');
  $chart['#labels'][] = t('Dairy');
  
  $chart['#data_colors'][] = '00ff00';
  $chart['#data_colors'][] = 'ff0000';
  $chart['#data_colors'][] = '0000ff';

  echo chart_render($chart);
}}}

== Line chart, legends, and resolution adjusting ==

As you can see in the chart below, the resolution of the encoding type choosen does not reflect well with the data provided. So in the chart below it, we set "'#adjust_resolution' => TRUE,".
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=t%3A1%2C3%2C5%2C4%2C2%7C2%2C2%2C4%2C3%2C1%7C5%2C2%2C3%2C1%2C2&cht=lc&chs=400x200&chtt=Servings&chts=cc0000%2C15&chdl=Fruits%7CMeats%7CDairy&chco=00ff00%2Cff0000%2C0000ff&chf=bg%2Cs%2CFFFFFF&chxt=y%2Cx&chxr=0%2C0%2C5&chxl=1%3A%7CMon%7CTue%7CWed%7CThu%7CFri.png

http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=t%3A20%2C60%2C100%2C80%2C40%7C40%2C40%2C80%2C60%2C20%7C100%2C40%2C60%2C20%2C40&cht=lc&chs=400x200&chtt=Servings&chts=cc0000%2C15&chdl=Fruits%7CMeats%7CDairy&chco=00ff00%2Cff0000%2C0000ff&chf=bg%2Cs%2CFFFFFF&chxt=y%2Cx&chxr=0%2C0%2C5&chxl=1%3A%7CMon%7CTue%7CWed%7CThu%7CFri.png

{{{
  $chart = array(
      '#chart_id' => 'test_chart',
      '#title' => chart_title(t('Servings'), 'cc0000', 15),
      '#type' => CHART_TYPE_LINE,
      '#size' => chart_size(400, 200),
      '#encoding' => CHART_ENCODING_TEXT,
      '#adjust_resolution' => TRUE,
    );
    
  $chart['#data']['fruits'] = array(1, 3, 5, 4, 2);
  $chart['#data']['meats']  = array(2, 2, 4, 3, 1);
  $chart['#data']['dairy']  = array(5, 2, 3, 1, 2);

  $chart['#legends'][] = t('Fruits');
  $chart['#legends'][] = t('Meats');
  $chart['#legends'][] = t('Dairy');

  $chart['#data_colors'][] = '00ff00';
  $chart['#data_colors'][] = 'ff0000';
  $chart['#data_colors'][] = '0000ff';

  $chart['#mixed_axis_labels'][] = chart_mixed_axis_range_label(CHART_AXIS_Y_LEFT, 0, 5);

  $chart['#mixed_axis_labels'][] = chart_mixed_axis_label(CHART_AXIS_X_BOTTOM, t('Mon'));
  $chart['#mixed_axis_labels'][] = chart_mixed_axis_label(CHART_AXIS_X_BOTTOM, t('Tue'));
  $chart['#mixed_axis_labels'][] = chart_mixed_axis_label(CHART_AXIS_X_BOTTOM, t('Wed'));
  $chart['#mixed_axis_labels'][] = chart_mixed_axis_label(CHART_AXIS_X_BOTTOM, t('Thu'));
  $chart['#mixed_axis_labels'][] = chart_mixed_axis_label(CHART_AXIS_X_BOTTOM, t('Fri'));

  echo chart_render($chart);
}}}
